answerText: Albigensian Crusade [or Cathar Crusade][10] The Albigensian Crusade was called against this dualistic sect of the Languedoc region by Pope Innocent III.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale A | 4 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: NOTE TO MODERATOR: Please don't reveal the alternate answer to the first part of the bonus. Thanks!] Henry de Beaujeu was a commander late in this conflict, which was declared after the assassination of Pierre de Castelnau. For 10 points each: [10] Name this conflict in which battles took place at Beziers and Carcassonne. Raymond VI of Toulouse grudgingly supported this war before becoming its primary target.
